intro: Boivinella sclerioides, commonly known as the African milk bush, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and milky sap. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is drought-tolerant. Its leaves are usually alternate and have a rough texture. Boivinella sclerioides is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
